cold_snaps.status: No active cold snap is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwave in progress.  So far, 6 heatwaves have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record amounts of rain fell over 7.9 hours today with a total accumulation of 13.04mm.  It fell at 8.6 mm per hour at times and ranked 8th from our records.  On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 27.64mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 15.9 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded on 03 September 2025 ranking first from our records.  This was sustained over 2.0 hours and 27.0mm per hour was faliing at times.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024, characterized by a peak rain intensity of 6.4mm per hour and a total rainfall of 24.56mm.
A storm is currently nearby.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, counting 9 days starting August 26, 2025, ranks 4th in length since records started in August 2024.

tropical: The last tropical night was July 18, 2025, with only 62 such nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (209°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 77.76 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.6 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1698 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 111.2m lower than yesterday, 594.8m lower than the past week, 1697.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 713m and a peak of 1594m, averaging 955.8m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. Moderate rainfall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and bright intervals likely. Weather could become unsettled.
